snippet: The trial in the 2005 assassination of Rafik Hariri in Lebanon is about to begin, but it has become another friction point in the Middle East’s sectarian showdown.
abstract: United Nations Memo; trial to investigate 2005 assassination of Lebanese Prime Min Rafik Hariri has become another friction point in sectarian conflict spilling over into country from Syria; Hezbollah, Shiite group that supports Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad, has been implicated in Hariri's murder, casting doubts on group's claims of being Lebanon's defender.

byline.contributor: Anne Barnard and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: The trial in the 2005 assassination of Rafik Hariri in Lebanon is about to begin, but it has become another friction point in the Middle East’s sectarian showdown.

headline.main: Mideast Strife Turns Trial on Beirut Assassination Into Another Fault Line
headline.print_headline: Mideast Strife Turns Trial On Beirut Assassination Into Another Fault Line

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
